Our experience started off with a short 3D movie, The glasses worked well and the closer you were the better it was. I was standing off to the side holding my toddler during the movie, the angle I was standing at made the butterflies seem like they were really floating by it almost made me want to wave them away before they hit my face. The movie was entertaining and educational, Next you move into the 'Hatching' room where they have dozens of butterfly cocoons hanging from boxes to view as they emerge from their cozy cocoons. I was fascinated and surprised to see the amount of different cocoons, some were bright green others were metallic gold, one looked like a spiders egg sack it was amazing to see them and to see the butterflies who had recently emerged sitting drying their wings.   If you go in Spring/slightly cooler weather and bring a sweat shirt, prepare to take it off as you enter the butterfly habitat it is humid and warm which is perfect for the butterflies. My family loved the butterfly habitat they are fearless little guys from getting used to seeing people, they fly right by you, will land on you, and may even bump into you from time to time I found even when my camera was sitting just an inch or two away from one of them they didn't fly away which made for some pretty good photo opporunities. I was slightly upset that I saw an african moon/lunar moth in the hatching room but didn't see any in the actual butterfly habiat. I enjoyed their selection of butterflies, We wish it was a slightly bigger building but it suited our interest. After there is a cafe which smelled good but we didn't purchase anything, a room with spiders, scorpians and bees we enjoyed watching the bees come in and out of the building carrying polen back to the hive. Following that room were tanks with assorted fish and a string ray petting tank, The attendant seemed a little rude but I am sure he deals with a lot through out the day. The gift shop was decently price, some things were over priced but that is part of how they make their money.   Over all it was a happy and exciting experience, I would visit again in the future. You do get quite a bit for the $11(kids), $20 (adults) price you have to keep in mind that not only do you get to explore and see the bugs,fish, ect but it cost quite a bit to keep them all living comfortably and happily.

If you like bugs then this is the place for you! I personally dont like butterflys landing on me hahaha!! But its an enjoyable experience if you want to see the life cycles also there are other bug attractions such as a bee hive where bees come and go, ant mounds and stingrays swimming.

This was a lovely place. The views of the ACTUAL chrysalises were fascinating (we thought they were fake!) The staff at every encounter were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.  There is not a tremendous amount to it for the admission, but would be worth it if outdoor activities were on hold due to weather or the like

This place is STRICT! That is because they want their butterflies to thrive.  Before going in with a group of kids they sat us down and gave us very rigid instructions on how to walk and act in the butterfly habitat.  They enforced that if one child didn't follow the rules then the whole group would be asked to leave! Luckily my kids did great and we all had a good time.   It starts with the 4D movie about a butterflies life.  Very cute movie.  Then you are shown how Butterfly Wonderland receives their stock. (We were able to see a worker add some new butterflies)  After that, you are brought into the observatory.  If you want butterflies to land on you wear bright colors!  You are instructed to walk slowly and to not touch butterflies with your hands. This is a beautiful area and I would suggest early in the morning because it gets very humid.  After the butterfly habitat there's a cafe and then the room with the aquariums and rays.  Once you're finished with the sea life you are lead back to the front inside the gift shop.    I enjoyed my trip to Butterfly Wonderland, and I know my schoolkids did too! We'd come back on another field trip.
Very interesting, but very crowded on a Saturday afternoon. Kind of expensive for the experience.

I feel so lucky to have this in my city!  What a beautiful and amazing experience for my family! The facility and the staff were A+.  We also really enjoyed the Native Storytellers sharing their culture with us.

We took visitors since this is one of the remarkable places for tourists in Scottsdale. We had been here before. On a patriotic holiday weekend they had red, white and blue butterflies in addition to the usual. We appreciate how much the vegetation has grown. We think the koi pond is great. What is best is being surrounded by clouds of butterflies.  Several landed on my flowered shirt and flew away disappointed.   In addition, there is an interesting film about the life of monarch butterflies, a butterfly hatchery and. small aquarium.  The girls we brought were thrilled by the experience.  Paying admission I was asked for student ID which they didn't have. I pointed out that they are 16 which got me Student Rate but perhaps was not really required. Is there that much admission fraud.

Loved Butterfly Wonderland. The movie was absolutely terrific, worth the price of admission. There were so many different butterfly types. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.  There was also a small aquarium. Good for about two hours.

Really cool place. The 3d experiance with the monarch butterfly was cool. But the best part was the crazy immersion into the butterflys rainforest like emvironment. The blue ones fly around like crazy and some just hangout. Definitely perfect for the whole family. And something to do to get out of the heat.

Visiting Butterfly Wonderland was never on my "to see" list.  I LOVE butterflies, but I have been to some really good butterfly gardens in my life.  When my sister came to town this last time, she wanted to go.  So we went!  I will start with the bad, and end on good...  Bad - It's expensive.  We both got student discounts and our tickets were over $20.  The place is mostly a large greenhouse.    Could be bad - The first stop is a movie, when the movie is over the whole theater goes to the Emergence Gallery (where you can see butterfly emerge from their cocoon).  Then the whole theater group goes into the Conservatory.  There were about 12 in our movie viewing so everyone had a chance to look into the emergence cases and we had plenty of personal space.  I can anticipate problems with crowds if the movie is even at a quarter of capacity.  The good - The staff was very nice.  The Conservatory is beautiful!  The butterflies are so active!  We got a lot of great pictures.

I would give them 6 stars if I could!   This place is so fun! I've brought my almost two year old daughter here twice now and she LOVES the "fly-ayes".  There is a 3D movie that you watch before going in but I have to skip it due to my migraines. The kids seemed to love it though.    Then you get to see the butterflies as they hatch.  The people who work in this place are super helpful and can answer all your questions.  They are friendly and attentive and we talked to several of the employees about the butterflies and how they hatch.  Then they bring you into the habitat which is a bit warm - 80 degrees and humid - because that's how the butterflies like it!  Then you will not believe your eyes as you roam around in an enclosure with HUNDREDS of butterflies - the guy inside told us 800 a week are replenished.  AWESOME.  So many different types of butterflies that I had never seen before.  And there is a small pond with large fish you can feed (the employees have food). My daughter loved everything - she loved walking around and seeing plants and butterflies and she even liked looking at the honey bee hive they have in the corner.    There is a snack bar and tons of tables/chairs when you leave the enclosure.  And then there are a few tanks with some fresh water fish and the gift shop.  Tons of cute and unique butterfly themed gifts, artwork, toys and clothes.  Really a fun day!  And the perfect trip for even a small child because you can spend a half day here and feel like you really did everything.   Highly recommend!

We just had a family day at Butterfly Wonderland. As others have said it's a little pricey, over 70.00 for 4 of us.  The 3D movie in the beginning is educational and fun... but it gets pretty amazing when you're let into the greenhouse area. I never thought I could be overwhelmed my butterflies but they are everywhere...and quite friendly!! Haha one of them landed on my hand and laid an egg on my thumb...no joke.  Our daughters were a little freaked out when the butterflies tried to land on them, but overall LOVED IT!! This would be a great place to take visitors or for a special time with family!!

Fun experience , although not an inexpensive adventure    There were plenty of butterflies dancing around to be able to really admire their beauty. It was interesting watching them feed. My sweet little 3 year old companion enjoyed herself. Looking at the fish after leaving the butterflies was nice.

OK OK, I was totally making fun of Butterfly Wonderland. It was near my hotel, and I kept passing it by on my way to do other stuff. "A butterfly exhibit? How boring" I said to myself. However, after checking out of the hotel, I found myself with several hours to kill before I needed to get to the airport, and as a joke, decided to check this place out.  Omg...it's worth it. You start off with a movie about monarch butterflies which was pretty informative, if a little dull. Then you're in a room where you can see cocoons, and that was neat. BUT, then you're let into a large greenhouse that is filled with butterflies and it's really quite impressive. There are a lot of varieties --- enough that you're constantly discovering a new one. And the plants and walkway is laid out so that you can get up close and personal with these butterflies.  Surprisingly, I burned through 2 hours here! Very unexpected and a fun little way to kill some time.

Great experience. We live in a dry desert, so enjoy the rainforest environment. It's humid, so dress appropriately. The movie was really great, staff and volunteers were helpful. Butterflies and the large moths are magnificent.

This place is very nice.  We decided to go on a Sunday around 10:30, I was surprised how busy it was.  We were 3 adults and 2 children, we had a coupon for up to $12 off, so it ended up costing around $76 for all.  Once you are in, they take you souvenir picture and then you can wait to watch the 3D movie or head to the butterfly area.  We decided to wait for the movie since it was only one minute away.  I am glad we did.  Even my kids loved the movie.  It was so funny to see them try to catch the 3D butterflies.  Once the movie is over you step into the Butterfly emergence gallery, where you can see the different stages of a bunch of butterflies, we saw some about to go from chrysalis to butterfly, it was really amazing.  After you enter a chamber and then there is the door to the Conservatory, where all the butterflies are.  This part is awesome.  There are so many varieties of butterflies flying all over and they can  even land on you.  My little boy loved it.   While my little boy stayed in the conservatory with dad and grandma, my little girl and I went to see the rest.  Before exiting you go to another chamber where you check in the mirror if you have any butterflies on you, since they want to make sure none escape.   You head out and walk through the small cafe and then there is a small room with 3 little glass tanks, one with a huge black scorpion, the other with a large hairy spider and the third one with the scorpions you see all over the place here in the valley, little brownish ones.  They have placed a couple of black light flashlights so you see how scorpions glow in the dark with the flashlight.  That part only took us about 5 minutes.   The last exhibit had a few fish tanks some with fresh water fish and others with ocean fishes.  They also have a viewing tank, they explained it is not a touch tank anymore because besides the rays, they have now 3 kinds of small sharks. The tricky part is the exit, you have to go through the souvenir store, so it is hard to leave without spending more money,  I guess that is the purpose.  Good thing grandma bought them a couple of things so the twins were happy.  Overall it is a great experience.

This place was great!  I can here with my gf and her friend and got to see a lot of beautiful butterflies, interesting insects, reptiles and fish.  I wish we could've touched the fish, but it was overall really great to experience a bit of nature in the middle of the desert
Amazing place!! Took my Mom here who is in a wheelchair. She loved it. Very serene, butterflies are literally every where and so many varieties! Very educational too.

My Girlfriend and I went here for the first time last weekend. In short, for a wonderful detached (from technology) time by yourself or with the family, then you have to visit this place.  Butterfly Wonderland is a pleasant surprise.  It is a photographer's treat.  I was like a kid in a candy store with my camera.    The garden is wonderful and the variety of butterflies all around you is simply amazing.

This was a wonderful hidden treasure! I can't believe it's been in Arizona for three years already! For $20 an adult, you learn about butterflies and months, see a 3-D movie, have the opportunity to witness them emerging from their cacoons or chrystalis, a conservatory full of butterflies from around the world, some Arizona desert native creatures, a honeybee hive (it was closed when we went), and finally some native fish of the Amazon!! Well worth the entrance fee!   The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and enthusiastic.   If you plan to come back, purchase a annual pass and you pay for it in 2.5 trips! Well worth it and a great place to take visitors! I can't wait to come back and visit again soon!

So, I am, or was, petrified of moths.  They totally freaked me out.  Because of my visit to this magical place I'm not so much afraid anymore.  (Thank God, I can now leave my doors open at night in beautiful weather and not be uptight about them flying in. )  After my sister and her husband paid over one hundred dollars for four adults and three children, we walked in and were able to catch a three d movie before experiencing the magical wonderland.  (Not being sarcastic either...it was amazing!)  But the movie was also exceptionally great.  With your nifty glasses, it appeared as if the butterflies were all over the theater.  And, it wasn't a boring documentary either.  The way the narrator told the story of one butterfly's life journey caused me to actually feel personally involved with this fragile creature.  It was time to enter this fairy tale like area where the butterflies gracefully fluttered in the hundreds.  They were everywhere.  We were told to watch where we stepped so as not to step on any that land on the path.  I have never seen so many butterflies in all my life.  It really was  quite magical for me.   When all my group was ready for a snack we went to the cafe.  Yes, terribly expensive, but it's relative. You'll need to remember I'm pretty cheap. Let me give you an example:  A pbj, the kind my students received when going on a field trip, a bag of chips and I can't remember what else, cost close to $5.   There is also a room with fish, sting rays that you were able to "pet" , and a few displays of bees, spiders, scorpions, (complete with a black light) ants, and a giant centipede. However, after being in the mystical room of butterflies, I wasn't impressed.  The butterfly wonderland is a hard act to follow.   The last thing I want to mention is that the staff was very friendly. There was a  guy who was busy caring for the butterfly room and as I stopped to take a pic, he asked if I had questions, which I did. The employees were great.    Yes, I would definitely recommend a trip to Butterfly Wonderland.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because I thought it was pretty pricey.  But then again, as I mentioned before, I"m cheap.  So, you decide.

I like this place, I like the idea of this place, I like the message of conservation and respect for nature that this place seems to support....  20$ a head is still kind of expensive and younger kids don't enjoy themselves as much.  It's more of an experience for someone that wants to go on a relaxing stroll and take a few pictures.    The facility is super small.  You will see butterflies and that's it.  The other exhibits (bee hive, terrariums with a few small Desert critters, and some fish tanks) are pitiful.

Me and the family went here one morning before lunch (4 adults and a 1 1/2 year old). There was no line to purchase tickets and it was quite expensive with 3 military discounted priced tickets. We next went to the theater for the 3D movie which was a 15 minute wait but was supposed to be a 5 minute wait. The baby was getting pretty impatient for the movie to begin. Once we got in the 3D graphics of the butterflies were really good at which the butterflies were right in your face. We left the movie early due to the baby getting cranky. The other animal exhibits were pretty cool but didn't get to enjoy them since we rushed through due to the child. The butterfly area was really beautiful and wasnt that hot at all. I was fine in it.  ** Don't bring any children under the age of 5 since you can't touch anything or else except the stingray exhibit.     ** I would have enjoyed it way more with just my husband if we were the only ones that went and so I could take my good old time through it.   ** Will not be going back here because the prices are just too high for us to afford again.
I love this place! I got an annual membership and visit often. It's so calming and beautiful. Makes me feel at peace. It's a great escape from the busyness of life.

The place is expensive and not great for kids/families looking for an indoor activity during summer. It is hot, humid & not pleasant inside. Only go if you are one of the following:  1. A butterfly enthusiast (think, obsession level) 2. That person who is always cold, looking for a warm environment   That's about it.   If admission was $5 then I'd give it 3 stars but the 2nd star is me being nice...

Such a cool place! I've never been anywhere like Butterfly Wonderland before. It felt like a tropical forest in there! There was the heat, the humidity, being surrounded by greenery and then, of course, the exotic butterflies fluttering about!  I will admit, it took me some getting used to. I typically flinch at things flitting about. And let me tell you, they flit! But they are gorgeous and they are so interesting to watch and admire (surprisingly enough). We noticed that if you are wearing colorful clothing and you sit on the benches, butterflies will land on you. It's pretty fun, actually.   I was super intrigued by the really cool exhibit right at the entrance of the wonderland rainforest. It shows you each step of the transformation process from caterpillar to butterfly. Super cool! And, on the way out, they have a cool room with big aquariums and some sweet fish. There's also a pool in the middle where you can pet the sting-rays. Not sure if this will stay once the aquarium opens up next door, but I think it should!   I actually found a few cute items at the gift shop and I genuinely enjoyed my visit. What a fun place to spend an afternoon with the family!

This is a must visit place!  You start by getting your photo taken.   These are for sale at the end of your visit in the gift shop. After pictures you see a 3D movie.  It was very well done.  Once you leave the theater you visit a little room where there are cocoons ready to open!  Then comes the big event....the butterfly room!  No strollers allowed.  You will have to park them outside the door.  It's a garden paradise complete with benches to sit, a waterfall & a pool with huge goldfish! The best part is that butterfly's will land on you! Once you leave the butterfly garden, you enter the snack shop.  Next comes a room with desert animals.  The little ones enjoyed using the black light flashlights to look for scorpions.  From there you go to an aquarium like room.  The centerpiece is a large pool with rays that you can touch. All around the pool are tanks with different fish. From there you go into the gift shop.

If you've never been to a butterfly exhibit, this is the one to see. They have an incredible variety of butterflies, every color in the rainbow. The plants in the conservatory are pretty spectacular too. The adult admission of twenty dollars is kind of high, however I'm okay with the nicely done educational experience this attraction provides.   Your admission includes:  The butterfly conservatory Movie: Flight of the Butterflies Butterfly Emergence Gallery An Active bee hive A Stingray petting pool  I spent a couple of hours watching these delicate winged creatures. I was mesmerized by the lime green and tropical blue butterflies. FYI - the blue butterflies are attracted to blue clothing!  Little kids need to be reminded that some of the butterflies rest on the floor and should watch their step at all times. This is not the place to run around or jump off stairs. One little boy had to be reminded.  Located in a newly developed area of Scottsdale. I will take others to see this when visiting in the area.

We were pleasantly surprised at how we enjoyed this butterfly pavilion. Seeing butterflies drying their wings after emerging from their cocoon was wonderfully charming. The courtyard had an abundant variety of butterflies and flowers for them to munch. All in all, it was a great stop. We recommend it. Oh...wear a brightly colored shirt, preferably with flowers,  the butterflies may very well go for a ride on your shirt.

The "mandatory movie" when you first enter is annoying- we came with out 13 month old and the guy regulating the movie/entrance made it seem like we weren't allowed in the museum without watching the monarch migration movie, we waited 10 minutes for the next movie (the movie is 14 minutes long) and realized we could easily by-step the movie. Honestly it was ridiculous and a waste of time to make us stand there waiting when you can go into the museum without interrupting the movie. The rest of the museum was oddly laid out and had random exhibits. The reason I am giving it 4 stars is the butterfly conservatory. That was really neat- and our son loved watching the butterflies.
What an incredible experience on a 110 degree day in Arizona en route to Chicago.  Beautiful butterflies in their habitat - perfect length 3d movie.  I could have stayed for hours

Well worth the money----  Food choices were limited, I wish they offered more and had a theme to the food.  I am a little surprised that a staff member told me they are not there to talk about the butterflies---but rather to make sure everyone behaved?!?!?!
This place is perfect to go to in the summer or if you have visitors. The butterfly sanctuary is beautiful and it's truly awesome whether your a child or an adult.

Definitely a fun place for children and adults alike. The butterflies are gorgeous and the cocoon exhibit was my favorite -- I got to watch metapods morph into butterfrees! (pokemon reference if you're a noob). It's pretty humid so I got drowsy after 10 minutes ... but I thoroughly enjoyed this place.

Amazing experience with the butterflies all around you. You will definitely pay for it. They have a small reptile exhibit compare to others but cool none the less. Also a marine exhibit. Kids loved the butterflies.

Fabulous!  Amazing!! Great 3D movie about the migration of the Monarch butterflies! LOVE being in the butterfly room with sooo many species and having them land on you so often!  Some of THE most beautiful butterflies I've ever seen!!

I believe the replies made by Butterfly Wonderland to some of the posts here pretty much sums up the experience here. It's just enough to be courteous but nothing extraordinary to make you want to come back. Why would a company provide canned responses that say "I'm sorry for your experience!" -and love the exclamation point in the end.   First I just want to say I have been looking forward to this for awhile. I've been talking about the building when it first came up and the future plans that are yet to come with the aquarium and Ripley's. I really hope this place does not represent what is yet to come.  First from the 101 freeway on outside this place looks to be nice and air conditioned. Oh my goodness please don't pay for a gym membership just come here for a sauna!  Yes we came when it was 115 degrees out but are you kidding me everyone was sweating buckets for how hot and humid this place was. I think we stayed in the butterfly area for 15 minutes. 10 of those minutes was close to the back where the "air" was. Seriously visit the 6 other months when it's nicer.   Which leaves me to this conclusion....what is this place thinking?  This is the desert. We Phoenicians love our AC at 75. No one goes out of the house unless there is an opportunity for shelter in an icebox.    This place is expensive at $20 a person.  I was willing to pay the price but expected so much more value. I've been to the butterfly habitat in a Six flags in Northern California and I felt like I had a much more enjoyable butterfly experience there than this dedicated place. Let me offer some tips to justify this price tag and bring more people in: 1. Seriously...board those windows up and get A/C and get rid of that humidity If its not the right climate for the butterflies then you better find some that do.  The other butterfly habitat I was at it was outdoors but was not humid and I believe it was about 80 degrees. You absolutely need to consider this to survive in the desert and for us locals to help spread the word on your establishment.   2.  Your employees better add to the experience than do the bare minimum. Try smiling, interact with the guests...add to the experience and don't just stock items. Those opening closing "protect the butterfly" human door guards need to have more personality. That was everyone's first and last experience of this place and it was blah. They need better coaching to bring their A game.   3.  The second half of the exhibit... What the heck is that? Random ant farms from hobby stores and scorpions that look like teens are trying to keep? I mean can you do better than a blacklight flashlight on a chain that doesn't work? Wire up a cheap button to light up a strip black light.    I really hope there are bigger plans for this it just really looked rushed or not well planned out. I think the bees thing was cool but the "experience" of it wasn't. It just wasn't presented well.   I love that the bees fly on and out of the building themselves. Yet there was nothing that told me that and it seemed hidden. I have no idea about the fish...I'm assuming they were inexpensive compared to the other fish and so you bought them.   4.  Upkeep. New building and there's paint missing and tape holding up the wall in the bee area? Cheap paper signs telling me to give me my ticket?  Think experience. This is my first impression. You paid thousands of dollars to get those giant butterflies in the ceiling and you go cheap on signs and upkeep?  Cafeteria get an interior designer. It just feels like a high school cafeteria than part of an "amusement park".   5.  Make this place more kid friendly. Maybe allow strollers. Nothing like holding a sweaty 97 degree kid next to me so she doesn't squash anything. Have a play area? I don't know we're customers you should know your clientele. This place obviously is to attract young families so think that way.   6.  Get tons more butterflies.  Okay now I'm ranting... If you are considering coming here wait for the fall or winter. I doubt you'll be back until prices are cheaper or if they make the premium price worth it. Just go to say you've gone.   I guess I'll see you in a few years when hopefully you're still here and you've improved.

I am torn on giving this 3 stars mainly because of the price as it was nearly 60 dollars for 2 adults and one child (one was free). The reason I will give it a 3 is because my daughters did enjoy it, but unless they add to the experience or adjust the price we wouldn't return.

Worst experience ever! It's super expensive and the staff is NOT friendly!! $60 for 1 adult and 2 children's for 30 min and that's include 10 min for a movie!! Again worst experience ever!!! So disappointed ! I don't recommend it whatsoever !!!
Quite honestly one of my favorite places in the world. The butterflies loved me and I had a couple cling to me for over an hour. The butterflies and plants are so beautiful. It was hard to leave.

I had the great pleasure of accompanying my mother to this exhibit on a recent trip to Scottsdale. I can tell you that the place is wonderful. We loved how they started with the video on the Monarch Butterfly. The atmosphere is both peaceful and breathtaking. A great place to visit by yourself or take the family to. I highly recommend.

An absolutely great time. Inside the butterfly atrium is like stepping into a dream. Thousands of butterflies of all shapes, colors and varieties flying around, some will even land on you. The movie was fantastic and the 3D effects were amazing. It was very informative and entertaining, great for kids and adults alike.   Before I went in I thought this would be a one time visit, but after touring the exhibit I considered upgrading to the annual pass. I decided against it, however I think I will make a return trip to Butterfly Wonderland.
I had a great time with my little one.  She asks to come here fairly often and I'm considering an annual pass.

This is a beautiful facility. The 3-D movie was interesting and enjoyable for the adults and the kids. Having been to the botanical garden's butterfly exhibit many times and never being that impressed, this setting had so much more to offer. We were allowed to stay in the butterfly area for almost 45 minutes, and we got to see and experience a wide variety of them while in the habitat. HOWEVER, the staff at this facility was grumpy and unpleasant. You would think that a business that caters to families and children would hire people that at least pretended to care about making the trip enjoyable... Especially for $13 per person. It is hard to enjoy any establishment when the people running it are pushy and obnoxious! Not one of them cracked a smile the entire time were there. From the guy running the movie who seemed to want to be anywhere else, to the woman guarding (yes... She is literally guarding it!) the sting ray exhibit, the staff there was sub par at best. After all is said and done, considering that the entrance fee for a family of 4 is over $50, we won't be returning.... No matter how pretty the wildlife is.

This place was the highlight of my vacation. I have never seen so many different types of butterfly's before and it was awesome walking around exploring the different ones and taking photos. I also loved that it wasn't all about butterflys that they also had a reptile section as well with snakes, frogs, alligators, monitors and more, and then also insects and tarantulas, they even had an aquatic area with fish and stingrays that you could feed (we didn't get to feed the stingrays tho cause they just got fed by other guests.) in addition to all of this they have a separate area right next to the butterfly place that is the aquatic center where you can explore different fish/wildlife. We wanted to buy tickets to go inside it but they were closing soon so we didn't get to explore much of that. but we did get to walk around the shopping center and go into different stores and found this ice bar that was pretty cool. Worth going for sure!

Anyone know what's going on with the little trailer by parking? It says it's some ody-sea aquarium thing .. ? We've been here before. My 7 y/o boy loves it. Last time, there were no bees or ants. Now those are on display and I think he watched the bees go in and out for 20 m. The only reason I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is bc I think it's a bit overpriced - as is the cafe.

2.5 review as this place just wasn't for me. I took my 21 month old daughter hoping that it would be something we could both enjoy. Being that it's summer in AZ, I wanted to avoid the zoo and figured this was a nice alternative. I was wrong. The atrium was grossly hot & humid. Maybe something to expect but I unfortunately didn't. It wasn't enjoyable, no matter how beautiful the butterflies are. My little girl loved it, but due to being scared that she would touch one (which is forbidden) I carried her the entire time. So if you come with kids who are hands-on, be expected to carry them.   I would say my biggest reason for only giving 2.5 stars was the admission price. It's way too much in comparison for the time you will spend. Two adults was over $40 while my daughter was free. We spent an hour there. So it was just not worth it and we won't be returning. Hopefully the aquarium they are building next door won't be as big of a disappointment.

Went with my three children as part of a homeschool field trip.  It cost just over $5 per person as part of the group.  We LOVED it!!  My kids did not want to go and were complaining.  Now they can't wait to go back again.  The 3D movie was very entertaining and we all learned quite a bit about monarch butterflies.  The display that has butterflies hatching out of their cocoon was my favorite part.  We got to watch 2 different butterflies hatch in the less than 10 minutes we were watching.  Kids had a fabulous time having butterflies land on them and taking pictures.  The scorpions and black light was fun.    Touching the sting rays was fun.  Look forward to coming back!

I have to admit, I wasn't sure what to expect. I found that I really enjoyed being able to get that close with the butterflies.  We took our teenage daughter who had a fantastic time because she is in to photography!  And not only the butterflies, the foliage is so well kept and makes for a beautiful environment.

Absolutely stunning!  First, you start with a cool and informative 3D movie...sets the stage for what beauty is about to come when you step into the butterfly atrium.  This place puts a smile on my face...you are surrounded by such beauty!  I have never seen so many butterflies and so many different kinds at that.  I took many photos, but they just didn't do it justice and it was hard to capture because the butterflies are moving so fast.    The entrance fee is pricey, but worth every penny!
Great new attraction here in Scottsdale, the 3D movie is great.  The atrium is amazing!!!

If u have little ones this is a great place, but going as an adult its only worth a one time visit.  it was very expensive and we were only there an hour.  We added the mirror/laser thing and that was not worth the extra cost in my opinion.  All in all it was ok, but i did leave wondering where all those butterflies poop...

Eh...it was OK. Brought my sons caregiver, my son (13) and myself...it was 58$!!! holy hella expensive!! My child has autism, so I wasn't sure what to expect from him with all the butterflies flapping about. We first saw the movie, which is good if you like 3-D stuff...but for me it just made me nauseated and gave me a bit of a headache. My son was NOT thrilled with the butterflies, and was shooing them away from him and trying to shoo them away with his foot too, so one of the workers got all in a tizzy about this...as if he was going to go kill the butterflies  or something...sheesh!!  While I was there I saw 4 people step on butterflies, and my son didn't even so much as graze against one....the guy clearly didn't understand the disability, or was just an ass...:(( the sting ray thing was ok as well, but not overly exciting...my son did seem to like that, but likely because he liked the fish in the tank, and water in general. Over all it was just Meh.....overpriced....WAY overpriced...I went, I saw....and now I don't think I will go again.....not until the other stuff is done in 2 years. This  is just MY experience...I'm sure others enjoyed it, but I didn't.

Great concept.  A great deal of thought went into the Atrium design and it flows nicely once you are in there spending quality time with the STUNNING collection of butterflies.  ** Note To Self:  Dress like a FLOWER next visit you get more butterfly dates **  Thank you for FREE entry on Mother's Day for Moms.  That was a pleasant surprise.  Ticket prices are MORE than fair and I would have happily paid to support the cause and keep my kids off the video games for several hours!  LOST1 STAR for poor crowd control, poor signage and generally ineffective human herd management.  Just a small tweak here and there will really improve overall efficiency on busy days.  GREAT PLACE TO GO - don't avoid it because its a little muddled when they huddle!

It was a little on the expensive side, but we had a great experience. We went to the butterfly and aquarium portion and really enjoyed it.  There is also an outdoor area you can walk around, with live music and places to eat.  My 2 year old cannot stop talking about going back!

Loved starting my new year with my fiance here at the exhibit. Really enjoyed the 3D movie experience. As well as the small aquarium section. For roughly $59 you can get a combo ticket deal for both the OdySea aquarium and butterfly exhibit both. If you live in the area, the same price buys an annual pass. Good deal IMO. You can pickup some neat souvenirs in the gift shop made by local craftsmen. I love my purple swallowtail butterfly ring. All products were made with naturally expired butterflies.
A vey cool place to visit in AZ. The science is great as is the 3-D movie. Best part is the butterfly exhibit - all sorts of colors and sizes. Many landed on us which my daughter was thrilled with.

This place was awesome! I attended with 2 -10 year olds and a 14 year old and we had a great time! I am a local and embarrassed to say that we've not been here before and what a gem.  I really thought the 3D movie on Monarch's was a fantastic experience and we learned a lot, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the butterflies were just the icing on the cake.  If you have children that are 'squeamish' about bugs you might want to think twice about this outing.  We also paid extra for the mirror maze and laser tag and the girls loved that as well. Overall a great 2 hours out of the AZ heat. I will definitely be returning!

Joy would sum it up.  Beautiful butterflies flying all around. Come for experience rather an expectation.  Four stars because it was fun, interesting, and unique.   Children love seeing the butterflies, photographers enjoy the easy access to great photo shots, most importantly this was a great place to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday.

Great experience for all ages. The Butterfly Wonderland allows you to get up close and personal with a massive variety of butterflies from around the world. They start off the tour with a beautiful video documentary regarding the life cycle of the Monarch butterfly. As you continue your journey through Butterfly Wonderland, you will never cease to be amazed at the newfound knowledge and appreciation you will have for this insect!

Lifetime members do not get as much as they promise when you initially sign up. They do not have any birthday gift for anyone over the age of 12. Children under the age only receive a free cup of Dip N Dots. I suggest a 15% off discount in their cafe or in the shop. They also don't offer a large variety of food at the cafe. There are few extra activities for members to save substantially on and they charge a lot for the extra activities they DO offer. Overall, we enjoy attending, but I would never purchase a lifetime membership, if I could do all over again. Sea Odyssey is supposed to have a "wine and cheese" night for parents, many complimentary things for their lifetime members and their customer service is very kind.
Lovely little conservatory. My girls had a blast having butterflies all over them. The day we went was not busy at all, which we enjoyed.

The little kiddos had so much fun here, they did not want to leave the atrium.  Now, the 10 year old and older kids were done after an hour.  They sat around and watched the little ones have fun giggling as butterlies land on them.  You have to see the 3D show all about the butterflies and migration before they let you inside the atrium.  We went about a month ago, and it was hot and humid inside with just misters and fans to cool you off.  I am not sure how uncomfortable that gets in the height of the summer.  I will not ruin it for you.  It is worth going at least once to check out all the live beautiful lepidoptera.

Well I'm falling down on the job!  Thought for sure I had already posted my review.  This place is fantastic and the variety of butterflies and moths are amazing.  It can get quite crowded in here with visitors but you never really feel like you are elbow to elbow with anyone.  Kids love it here unless they are the squeamish type about bugs or things flying around them.  Stand still long enough and one will land on you which is fun.  They are just so beautiful.  There is an education center in there and a small snack area as well as the mandatory souvenir shop.  Even though the entry fee is steep (almost $20.00) it was worth it.

What a great experience.  One of the best attractions of the Valley. Young and old alike will enjoy their time in this beautiful oasis. Standing among thousands of beautiful butterflies flying around you was an overwhelming experience. Every where you look there is a photo op. The area with the fish was great.  We got to pet and feed the stingrays. The large tanks help fish from around the world. I recommed this for everyone.

What a fantastic experience for all ages. A must see.  Don't miss out on this one. We love it so much that we've gone back about 5 times so far.  We also loved the Laser Maze and Mirror Maze next door.

What a unique experience for kids, not so much boys so thankfully I got a girl to share this with. Brand new state of the art facility, so I'm assuming thats what your paying for at the ticket counter. A bit pricey if you ask me but the gift shop was actually reasonable so thats a wash in my book.....  We were just in time to catch a 3D documentary on the flight & life of a monarch butterfly. I've seen this before on the tele but it was pretty cool in 3D. Then from there we went into this staging room before the atrium were we got to see several different types of butterflies emerging from their cocoons. Pretty cool! This place is great because there is no rush, it's all at your own speed. After watching butterflies break out of their cocoons we were off to the atrium. a butterfly haven. NO TOUCHING, NO PICKING UP but if they land on you thats ok. Hard for a little girl to grasp so I had to keep reminding her. Trust me when I say the butterfly keepers are on it too! The only thing I don't like about this experience is Summer, it was nice and toasty in there and the humidity was off the charts. From there tho you can cool down in the snack shop before you continue on.....  The next area is about insects & fish. Really good displays of both & a shallow tank with sting rays in them for petting. Not as spectacle as sea world but worth saving yourself a 5 hour drive over. You make your way thru the gift shop and after that your at the entrance/exit, round 2-sure, there's no time limit, how great!   My recommendations is try enjoying this place in better weather, you'll get your monies worth for sure being able to stay longer. Thank you who ever put this together, a great thing to have here in the valley. I will refer like mad!

Went there for my birthday. It was expensive for our group since we were a large group. The butterflies were beautiful and it was so cool getting to be so close to them. I would've liked there to be more info available about all the different butterflies that were there, or maybe the workers to be able to give a little more info than they did.

We had a great time! They start you off with an informative 15 minute 3D movie about the life of Butterflies. Then you go to the butterfly hatchery. I thought I was looking at dried up dead cocoons and then to my surprise I saw Live Butterflies emerging and then it turned exciting! The butterfly room is very magical. It's like it's storming butterflies. All kinds of butterflies! The butterflies are everywhere. You don't have to look for them. They look for you and land on you. You have to walk real slow and be careful not to step on butterflies because they also land on the ground by your feet. I would have spent more time in the butterfly room but it was very hot and very humid but it was enough for me. Afterwards you get to see some bonus fish and reptiles and then you walk out threw the gift shop. You can get a discounted ticket combined with OdySea.   We both enjoyed it more than we thought we would!
Great time with 4 and 2 year old boys.  Would come back if the prices weren't so high.  Coupons barely put a dent in it.  Beautiful experience though.

Great, fun place. I took my daughter here and she loved it. Had an amazing time. The 3D movie was great, don't skip it, it's really great!!! My daughter had a lot of butterflies land on her, that really made her day.  We will be back. We also got to touch stingrays. I know they are expanding, that will be excitng when completed. Thinking of doing the membership.

Here is my response to butterfly wonderland:  I would think some retraining the retail staff would be in order. I understand I didn't have my receipt in the bathroom when I was in the middle of washing my daughters hands and the ball. I would appreciate more an apology from said staff who accused me publicly of stealing in front of other ladies in the bathroom to myself and my daughter in front of all the retail staff. I was not informed I needed my receipt and the staff who I bought my ball from didn't inform me as I signed my credit card receipt before leaving the gift shop with my daughter to go back into the exhibit. If that is policy wouldn't that staff tell me that as I'm signing my receipt or offer me a bag which she didn't. The staff whom I bought it from had time while I signed my receipt to tell me these things which she definitely didn't tell me I needed my receipt with a purchase especially without a bag if that is your policy? Some retraining about that may be helpful to avoid another situation like this. The staff who tried to chase me down into the bathroom should have checked with other staff. Most people who are stealing something don't go further into an building and not one without an exit. She publicly and purposely humiliated me in front of others when she was in the wrong and then didn't even come to apologize I had to seek her and the staff who I bought the ball from apologized to me first. I don't care to utilize my hard earned money at your place and I would reconsider if I felt validity of your staff's retraining on what to say to someone which isn't accusing them of stealing, that once your staff found out from the staff whom I bought the ball from she should have seeked me out and apologized profusely. But no she waited for me to come find her and ask if she had talked to the staff and have that staff whom I bought the ball from apologize first and then her apology which was Muttered. It's things like that which may need to be discussed with all retail staff and an public apology from your staff to me and my daughter would help me feel better about those situation and want to recommend this place to others. But as it is now I will not be back and I will be glad to not recommend it to others because of your retail staff. I am continuing to email anyone higher up about my experience in the retail part of the butterfly wonderland

We wanted to do something fun and mostly flat since someone in our party was in a wheelchair. When I looked at a previous review they talked about expensive the food was so decided to eat prior to our arrival. They offer different price points for different packages of things to do. I'm not sure a folding should be housed, never the less in the desert so we did the butterfly  exhibit  for our party and my daughter and I did the mirror maze and laser game. We entered a theater and were shown a portion of a 3D movie about monarch butterfly. We the were taken to see some butterfly cocoons and the through to the exhibit. It's humid in there for the butterflies and boy there were a ton. A coy pond is also here along with some birds. Also a honey bee area. It was a beautiful area and defiantly worth the time spent walking around. Best thing is to just sit and watch all the colors flying around and hope one will land on you.

I was relieved to love every minute of this, even the movie with scoffing idiots behind me and overly perfumed grandmas in front of me, because I knew that if I didn't feel psychotic joy at a butterfly wonderland I'd have to accept myself as irreparably jaded.  The chrysalis/cocoon room was like slow-motion Christmas; I could have never moved on to the atrium and still been absolutely psyched about what I got to see. Those metallic chrysalises! Enormous moths with wingtips that mimic snake heads!  BUT THEN I WENT INTO THE ATRIUM. Raining butterflies. Bright blue giants swooping around your legs, reds and greens and lavenders alighting on trees and fruits, and completely charming attempts by the occasional lady butterfly to deposit eggs on an unsuspecting-but-enchanted guest. I was worried about the humidity beforehand, but it was the last thing on my mind when I got in there with my camera and transformed into an excitable eight-year-old.  The best part of the 3D monarch film was the little kid next to me who kept reaching out to grab the butterflies. The best part of the non-butterfly exhibits was the UV-fluorescing scorpions.  Wishlist:  1. A viewing room for feeding caterpillars, to complete the progression of the life cycle. Sounds like they currently ship pupated stock to the facility rather than rear on-site; one hopes these are not collected from the wild.  2. Instrumental music or recordings of rainforest noise in place of horrifying Small World-style tunes and hippie serenades.  Ultimately, the day I visited Butterfly Wonderland was the day a blue Morpho landed on my head, and that was all I ever really wanted.

Have been twice - would recommend it as a family outing. One tip - go in the winter/cooler months, and stay away during peak summer temps. Also, wear red (or other bright colors?) - red seemed to be a great draw to the butterflies, and several landed on me, but not others in our group wearing more muted colors.  Tickets are a little pricey - $42 for 2 adults (1.5 yr old was free). Amazingly, our 1.5 yr old sat through the movie perfectly, without wearing the 3D glasses. The atrium was super humid and a bit uncomfortable, but to be expected on a day where it was 115 out. During our first visit earlier this year, it was perfect temps inside the atrium - even with a (red!) sweater on.

What a place!  Expensive (2 Seniors, 1 adult, 1 student ran $80).  We didn't buy the add-on ticket for the Maze, but the main museum was wonderful.  First, the 3-D intro movie was really good!  Excellent 3-D and a fine intro to the world of butterflys.    After the movie, you are sent into the next room a few people at a time.  This is the room where you actually see butterflys as they develop and are :born."  The room is too small for even 25 people to be able to see the live progression and there was no one explaining what we were seeing.  The trip from the movie to the rain forest needs improvement.  The high point was entering the rain forest type room and being right next to thousands of beautiful creatures. (Be sure to take your camera).  Plenty of places to sit and watch.  Especially watch the children as the butterflys actual light on them (wear red - red seems to attract them).  We spent 30 minutes there and could have spent a lot more time.  The neat thing is there are sooo many breeds (?), so the colors are really spectacular.  If it weren't for this room, it would be a 2 or 3 star.  The next two portions - not much.  The bee exhibit and the ant exhibit were very small, almost like a afterthought, poorly explained and again, no one to explain or answer questions.

This was an interesting experience. Go for the butterflies and don't expect much else in terms of entertainment.   When we entered we were given no explanation as to what was to happen. (No "Go right this way folks!") No general instructions, nothing. I assumed we could walk around and see various exhibits. First, guests are escorted to a movie theater. We were lucky and got there early so didn't have to wait in a long line. The movie was just long enough to be interesting and learn new things and short enough so pre-schoolers wouldn't get bored. It was actually a very nicely done 3D film.  Next you can view the chrysalis dangling but have to wait to get outdoors to see the main attraction...the rainforest with butterflies! Our wait wasn't long because of the time we arrived.  The best part of this place is of course seeing all the gorgeous butterflies flit around the outdoor rainforest. We spent most of our time there.  There are some great photo opportunities and everyone seemed to be enjoying it from the toddler set to grandparents. We didn't leave until each one of us had a butterfly land on us. Great fun!   Next we saw the smallish ant exhibit, and the bee exhibit. Both are pretty low-key. My grandson liked the scorpion tank where he could see them glow with a florescent light. Cool!  There is a stingray installation but you can skip it if you've been to wonderful aquariums like Monterey Bay Aquarium.  All-in-all, we spent a couple of hours there. It's not cheap..by no means. For 3 adults and a pre-schooler, it was around $73.   I would take guests there again. It is unique enough to spend the $$ again.

Butterfly Wonderland provides a fun experience for kids of all ages! Trust me, as a big kid I enjoyed it and my four month old enjoyed it too! It's much more impressive than it appears from the outside and it looks like the area is only going to get more exciting next summer with the expansion. Butterfly Wonderland captures the true beauty of the butterfly. I didn't quite realize how fascinating the beautiful winged creatures were until I saw the movie they play when you arrive. Learning about their journey and how unique a Monarch butterfly actually is made it all the more exciting to step into the butterfly exhibit.   Butterfly Wonderland consists of a movie theater, rainforest filled with butterflies, a miniature aquarium and a bug exhibit. Most importantly, it's all indoors which means you can enjoy it all year long. I never saw such beautiful butterflies before visiting Butterfly Wonderland. I saw electric blue butterflies, bright orange ones and plenty of beautiful Monarch butterflies. Before entering, there is an entire room filled with cocoons and if you're lucky, you'll witness the birth a butterfly during your visit.   This is worth the price of admission and it's a lovely experience for a family. I can't wait for the expansion to open in Summer of 2016 (an aquarium, ferris wheel, dolphin experience and merry-go-round) just to name a few!   Alongside Butterfly Wonderland is a laser maze which I didn't do but it also looks pretty fun!

My family of 4 (3 and 5 yr old) wanted to love this place, but it was a waste of money!!!  We want our $60 back!! First of all, they claim to have the largest conservatory in America.  Yes, by blueprint this may be true, but when you walk in it does not look like a rainforest in anyway and you only see one or two types of butterflies.  Please make way to Houston's butterfly conservatory (Texas).  That is a real rainforest carrying all kinda of butterflies from around the world.  Also, there was no information to be found on walls about anything you saw.  They give these cards to the children to ask a volunteer for a "fun fact" and we only passed 2 volunteers! There was no one available to tell you what you were looking at.  No signage of explanations of any sort.  How is this educational? Please please do not waste your money.  You are better off watching YouTube videos or going to the library for information. Also, they had ants and bees.  Same thing no descriptions.  We walk into this tiny aquarium with maybe 3 fish tanks with 2 fish in them.  We saw one lady who asked if we were going to do some petting.. Um ok and proceeds to give us hand sanitizer. First of all what are we petting?? We put our hands in the water to pet what looks like a stingray??? No signage??!!! No one is there to tell us anything!!! So disappointing.. Again, why is this educational? The fish in the tank has a white piece of paper on the wall that looked like they had just printed it earlier that morning with the name of the fish.  That's it!! No other information about where the fish is from.. Nothing.  My husband made a comment.. Hey we eat that fish.  You can get that at the Asian market. Lol oh and when we waited to see the movie, a man came in and had to read off a piece of paper his welcome message which had nothing to do with the movie.  just about where the exits were.  Lol nothing to see here.  The only cool thing my kids got was a butterfly and caterpillar balloon that was not made by them (Willie's creations) because it was the grand opening weekend.  Also, the 3d flight of the butterflies movie was great for the kids, but not worth $60. I don't think so.  Save your money and go to desert botanical.  At least there are people who can give you information. Oh and need to add... It took us 35 min (not including movie) to see everything.  We had planned for this to be at least a 2 hr adventure for the price we were paying!!
Hood place to spend sometime with kids. Something unique among the places i ve been to

as a short little birthday treat for my butterfly obsessed lady, we went on a little tour of this relatively new item in scottsdale.   i found it strange when they were building it, out in the desert, in a non-descript parcel of land off the 101, why anyone would build a butterfly sanctuary in arizona, land of 120 degree summer temps?  well they did, and it was only a matter of time before we would go.   we bought tix online and good thing we did because the ticket lines were super long. we were able to get in quickly, get our stamp and wait for about 5 minutes for the "flight of the monarch" 3-D movie. it's a neat little show about the monarchs, but we had more than a few screaming kids in the audience for the 15 minute show.   on to the chrysalis, or butterfly nursery exhibit. that was really neat to see real live butterfly's being "born". there is an ant, bee, small aquarium exhibit, and desert insect exhibit, but the real fun starts in the butterfly exhibit.   tip: wear bright clothes and you're likely to get a few of these delicately beautiful insects to land on you!  there were hundreds of absolutely magical butterfly's floating around. their colors and the closeness as to which you could approach them was truly amazing. they are bugs and only live 2 weeks, but it's still very neat to see them up close and be awed how pretty they are.   weekends are probably packed, but on this sunday around 11am, it wasn't too bad. all the staff were super friendly and the price is decent for an hour or 2!

Oh my goodness did we enjoy ourselves or what, being that it was Valentine's Day it was very busy lots of children & adults alike.  The price is reasonable $19.95 for adults & $12.95 for children  Pros & cons   Con :  long lines Lines can be long!!! I got a bit anxious because I couldn't wait to see the butterflies, they recommend you see a 3D 15 min movie about the life of the monarch butterfly I didn't want to but so glad we did !!! Best 3D I've ever seen so cool and realistic.   Con : very humid in the atrium, ladies if you go expect the hair to go flat in 0 to 20 seconds so use a high humidity hair spray.   Con : parking overflow !!!  Pros : Butterflies butterflies butterflies everywhere? They land on you and just hang out like little buddies, it's a ticklish feeling.  They can touch you but you can't touch them.    Pros : amazing photos everywhere you turn   Pros : clean restrooms, friendly staff overall fun experience   It's fun for all ages if you've never been you should totally go   Enjoy the butterfly kisses that they give you   anyone desires a wish to come true they must first capture a butterfly and whisper their wish to it. Since a butterfly can make no sound, the butterfly can not reveal the wish to anyone but the Great Spirit who hears and sees all.  In gratitude for giving the beautiful butterfly its freedom, the Great Spirit always grants the wish. So, according to legend, by making a wish and giving the butterfly its freedom, the wish will be taken to the heavens and be granted.

The Monarch film was very informative and the 3D feature made you feel like you were there! The vast number of chrysalis varieties was fascinating! Some looked like sleeping bats. Some like seed pods. And some like liquid gold! So pretty! We enjoyed the garden where the butterflies fly free. Fun when they land on you! There were many signs throughout the facility that talked about conservation. So I was extremely disappointed to discover there are no recycling bins anywhere inside or out! Seems very contradictory for them to encourage us as visitors to be eco-friendly, and yet not offer bins to get rid of any recycling!

Being thus far child free, I'm not sure Butterfly Wonderland was really worth it on a crowded Saturday.  At $41 for two full adult admissions, you might be better suited attending and a quiet Tuesday when you can really stand around staring for awhile.   The Wonderland begins w/ a 3D movie which is light on science, heavy on emotional pull (especially for those kiddies), and occasionally sprinkled w/ unexpected but welcome warnings about butterfly habit destruction.  Not sure there was a single real butterfly in the whole movie, but the 3D effect are actually somewhat stunning, even if they are a bit blurry, sometimes.  The small hatchery, obviously only a portion of the location's incubation activities is still sort of lovely to look at: Chrysalides are varied and range from sparkly and golden to horrific and alien.    Butterfly room gets to be a bit much after 20 or so minutes.  Obvious word of warning:  You will be wet. And sometimes blind, as steam is continually pouring into the environment to keep things a little bit tropical.  Butterflies are everywhere, so uncontrollable children might prove lethal and are better left stomping around at home.    But, there are butterflies! You're not allowed to taunt or beckon, but sometimes you're lucky enough to be a safe haven for a big blue winged thing for a couple of seconds.    Butterfly Wonderland also includes some ant and bee colonies as well as a small underwhelming aquarium and sting ray tank (All the rage these days, poor string rays.  The tank at World Wildlife Zoo in Surprise still reigns supreme, in terms of number and charming hunger of the rays).   A cafe sells something or other.  Low grade and over priced, if it matches other museum/zoo food options.  Gift shop full of gift shop type stuff.  Entire location is flat (except for one raised and ramped section of the Butterfly room) so wheelchairs are definitely welcome.
Outstanding for young and old. Beautiful butterflies and great venue to get close and interact.

Wow! A unique and remarkably beautiful environment one must experience in AZ. I took my toddler and it wasn't the right fit for the cost and the time that she was entertained. Great activity for older kids and adults though!

Fun to go through with kids or if you love butterflies!  I recommend watching the videos, very informative.  The highlight of course is the butterfly encounter, all sorts of beautiful butterflies and moths!  Doesn't take long to go through, around an hour!  Keep in mind the encounter is very humid, and your hair will feel it!!
Be advised. Must love butterflies. It's 20 bucks to get to walk thorough a butterfly Sanctuary. The sanctuary wad kinda cool..but the placee is crazy disorganized and a bit overpriced.

Love this place! There is a 3D movie, that I found educational.  Be advised the atrium where the butterflies fly around freely is humid, but after all; how else would you expect rain forest weather to be like. This place is great for all ages, also they have an amazing gift shop.

Was debating whether or not I wanted to spend $20 to see butterflies for a while, but on Sunday I decided to go for it! While I still think tickets were too pricey, it was worth it for a one time thing. The 3D movie made me dizzy and that usually doesn't happen, so beware of that! But it was informational, and kept my attention. The area with the cocoons was interesting too. The atrium was less humid than anticipated which was good! It was very pretty in there with all the plants and butterflies. None landed on me, sadly. It was a little smaller than I had expected though. We also checked out the small portion of the aquarium that is open and it was cool! Just one room of fish and a sting ray touch pool. Though we couldn't touch any of the stingrays, they wouldn't come up to us haha. But I liked it and it got me pumped for the full aquarium to open next year!

Do you like butterflies?    Do you like them enough to spend $20 or so per head to see them?  If the answer is yes, I suggest going during the 8 months of the year that are not summer.  They "said" it would be around 80 degrees / 80% humidity inside the butterfly area - there's no way it was cooler than 90 in there and yes, the humidity was ridiculous.  The 3D film they show is interesting (migration of the monarch) - and the staff is helpful / nice enough, but it was just so dang expensive.  I went with my three year old niece, and she did get a kick out of it, but certainly not something I'll go back to on purpose.  I understand it's expensive to import all the pupae - and there were certainly some exotic and beautiful things to see, but for the price I honestly expected to be wowed more.    In summation, don't go between June and September and check online for coupons / discounts before showing up to ease the sting of the cost.
Amazing experience! My mother loved it for Mother's Day! I recommend it to anyone looking for a fun date or just a fun day out with the family.

The kiddies loved it! Pricey but worth it because got to see a large variety of species of butterflies and a few of the butterflies actually hatching. Seeing a huge atlas Moth was pretty neat too.  Highly recommend it for families.

What a great time being surrounded by thousands of butterflies. They give you a whole history on the stages of butterflies and it's pretty interesting. They also have some aquariums and desert creatures.  When in Scottsdale this is a great place to take the kids.  Also have the aquarium next door which is not as neat but still worth a visit.

Butterfly Wonderland is something you should do at least once when you're in Arizona, whether you are a tourist or a local. From the moment you walk in you are greeted by friendly faces and you get a photo taken (not worth the money) on a green screen, later butterflies are edited in. As you're being walked back to a small movie theater to start your educational journey, you'll notice on the walls rare butterflies enclosed in glass frames for display. You receive a pair of fashionable 3D glasses. A movie plays on the screen where you follow a young butterfly in its lifetime. I haven't seen a movie in 3D in a long time and I was definitely impressed with how high the quality was, I felt like I was in it. After the movie is done, you walk out into a room to get to the atrium where you are greeted by a staff member. Once everyone is in the room, the staff member explains a couple of rules in order for us to keep the butterflies safe. As the door slowly opens, it feels like you are walking into a dream. You are instantly greeted by colorful butterflies. The atrium is decked out head to toe in lush and full greenery. Watch your step though! These little friends may land on the ground. The Atrium is equipped with clear pathways for wheelchairs, koi pond, and a big butterfly chair to get your picture. This is where you will be spending a majority of your time (highlight/main attraction). You will get plenty of photos with exotic butterflies landing on your shoulder and even in your hair! Mind you, you can come in and out of the atrium as much as you want. Exiting to the next portion you're going to have to check to see if anyone hitched a ride in front of a big mirror. You don't want to take them home with you! Next you'll see some of the common desert creepy crawlies, ranging from scorpions which you can light up with black lights. Tarantulas, Ants, and even Bees! You can see the bees making honey right in front of you. The last part is probably the most unique, it's an AQUARIUM! It even has a stingray interaction where they will swim up and glide over your fingers. There is many other assortments of interesting looking marine life surrounding the stingray tub. Sadly we did not attend the maze next door because of the overpriced charge. Ending the journey you walk thru the gift shop where you are able to purchase fun souvenirs and knick-knacks, also that is where you may purchase your overpriced photo. I hope that this has enticed you to experience what I have. Keep an eye out for the OdySea In The Desert, which is being built next door by 2016!
expensive, doesn't last a long time and they charged me twice. so, i suggest going out in nature & seeing them instead of $20 a person

The movie about the migration of the Monarch was great.  Being in the room with butterflies all around was really mystifying and beautiful.  The only downside is that it is a little pricey, but being that we were on our honeymoon, we were willing to pay.

Six words  Get up early in the morning  The butterflies go crazy here at sun rise.  They have new features since they first opened. The 3D movie is great. The outdoor couches seem impossible to sit on during the summer.  Maybe they should invest in misters.

Entry for an adult with tax is about $21, a child is about $13. For the price you experience a ten minute 3-D movie. That is followed by a visit to the atrium. It is very lovely ,however ,even at a leisurely pace you are through in about 10 minutes. Be prepared to have butterflies Dive-bomb your head and land all over you. You must also be careful not to step on the butterflies. This is followed by a room with a few aquarium tanks Where children are given the opportunity to touch stingrays. Just be aware that the whole tour takes an hour max and would quickly bore children.

I was not sure what to expect here but I'm so glad we went!  It was amazing!!  Educational (but surely not boring) and incredible to walk amongst all the butterflies.  Absolutely beautiful, peaceful and awe inspiring.  Our 24 year old son even loved it!  The movie shown at the beginning is great to help understand what you are seeing in the butterfly garden.  I'm not sure why some complain about the price.  We were there for 3 hours so $20 for 3 hours of entertainment is well worth it!  And, the cost to maintain all the butterflies from around the world justifies the admission fee.  I highly recommend an outing to Butterfly Wonderland while in Scottsdale.

I admit it. I was prepared to not be impressed, but I was and I really enjoyed it. It's expensive and honestly I can't see spending more than one hour maybe two. The 3D movie is wonderful. The atrium is lovely, so many butterflies flying around, landing on you. I felt like I was in another country. While my kids liked it, we discovered my 3 y/o  is terrified of butterflies, hehe.  Definitely go first thing in the morning: less crowded and not as hot. Like someone mentioned, it's a place to go at least once.

We loved our time here. The movie was very informative and makes you want to build a butterfly garden! There's no rush while your here, just take your time and walk about all the different varieties of butterflies. Sit a bit and just watch them. The staff is very friendly.

"Butterflies! Butterflies! Butterflies!"  Butterflies are pretty much all my toddler would talk about today after our visit to Butterfly Wonderland.  I didn't really have expectations going in to check this place out; I only knew that they were newly opened and had lots of butterflies and a 3D butterfly movie.    I went with Alexa M (my sister-in-law) and my two kids (both under 2).  Luckily the kids were free because my adult ticket was $18.95 and Alexa's student ticket was $16.95... kind of pricey for what it is!  We found all of the employees very friendly -- especially Myrna who took our tickets and gave us our 3D glasses upon entering.  She even gave my son an extra butterfly stamp on his hand since he's kind of obsessed with both stamps and butterflies!  And while he wouldn't sit still for the movie, he absolutely loved seeing the butterflies in the atrium despite the humidity.  He also loved the fountain and fish (both indoors and out).  The cafe and gift shop were satisfactory but overpriced.  Even so, this is a fun place to visit with the kids or without.  If you're looking for an activity to eat up an hour or two max, and you have some extra $$ to spend, I do recommend this place... We actually ended up getting annual passes since my son liked it so much.
Great for kids, great for those wanting to spend $70 to see butterflies.  Serious -$70 - butterflies.  Pro tip - www.google.com then images - type butterflies.  You are welcome.
Quite enjoyable.  Took my great niece and she  it.  As always spring break is a tough time visiting any attraction, anywhere.

My family and I are lifetime members of Butterfly Wonderland, and I cannot say enough great things about this place. It is a place where you can have an educational and fun time, and it is great for all ages. We have seen it really grow within the past few years, they keep adding more and more. So, if you went a few years ago and haven't been there lately, I highly recommend a return visit. The conservatory is amazing. The butterflies are gorgeous, the koi pond is so peaceful, and the reptiles are really interesting to observe as well. Love it so much!

Liked this one a lot especially when visiting with family and friends. Lots of great pictures. They definitely have the marketing concepts down for maximum capitalization but nothing offending.  Would visit again. Great for a young family or gparents but not a repeat performance for an annual pass.

We went to BW on a Saturday afternoon and expected it to be packed- luckily it was busy but the traffic flow of BW was very well orchestrated. When you first come into BW you go into a small theater and watch a really cool 3D movie. Probably one of the best 3D movies I have ever seen. The movie is about 15 mins long. From there you go into a room where you can see butterflies at all different stages of coming out of their chrysalis's. Then, from there- into the atrium. Now, this is advertised as "America's Largest Butterfly Atrium". Is it really? Eh. I saw a previous review that complained that it was hot and humid in there....duh- it has to be. Come prepared for that. With that said, I wouldnt recommend coming in July/August. But you can walk around the atrium as long as you want and it is truly beautiful to see all the butterflies fluttering around. I was hoping to see more varieties of butterflies, but it was still pretty cool.   After the atrium you can go in and check out the bees, ants, fish, and stingrays. This is all pretty new and it shows- if you have seem the sting rays at the Phoenix Zoo- dont waste your time with the stingrays at BW. Finally- you go into the gift shop. Prices were reasonable. It would be great if they could eventually sell the honey fromt he bees.   Last, is the "Mirror Maze" and "Laser Maze" area. This is so obviously an after thought and I was HIGHLY disappointed in the staff in this area. We had never been here before and the staff did not explain how to do the laser maze to my 7 and 9 year old kids. The girl running the laser maze just said to them, "Okay, go in." But the laser maze has 3 stops the kids need to check in at to complete the maze. However, I wasnt actually surprised by the poor customer service here because it was the general theme throughout BW.   Bottom Line: For the $20/person admission- this place needs to seriously invest in quality staff. Yes, the butterflies are pretty and this place has potential to be a wonderful gem- but they have got to realize that people are paying for an experience. Not a single employee we interacted with was smiling nor were they helpful in anyway, shape, or form. They could be walking around sharing facts about the butterflies, stingrays, fish, etc...instead they only bark orders to not touch and to let them take the butterflies off you.

A very fun trip for the whole family. The movie portion is a little long if you have VERY young kids but the butterfly part is fantastic. ITs very hot and humid so be prepared for your hair to frizz and leave dripping wet. WE will probably save this activity for the winter time, not the AZ Summers.

This morning (Tuesday) was our first time visiting the Butterfly Wonderland.  It took 45 minutes of waiting in line to get in (there were numerous school groups that took priority over the general public). I would call before going to see how many field trips the Butterfly Wonderland is hosting, and at what times, so you can avoid the frustration.

This is a great place to take kids on a field trip or outing.  The kids really enjoyed the 3D movie about a Monarchs' life cycle, getting to explore in the atrium and interacting with the sting rays.  I'm glad I went as part of a field trip b/c I feel the admission price is a bit much for such a short tour.  The food selections in the snack bar were sparse and a bit pricey.  There are several fast food places/restaurants on the next exit over (Indian Bend).  If it were cheaper, or they offered a local discount I would bring many guests here.

Butterfly Wonderland owes my visit to Yelp.  I was scrolling through Yelp and I saw the pictures of previous Yelper's visits, so I wanted to check it out.  BUTTERFLY WONDERLAND  Butterfly Wonderland is the largest butterfly conservatory in America.   It features an indoor conservatory that brings a tropical rainforest environment to Arizona where thousands of butterflies fly freely.  Butterfly Wonderland is located at OdySea in the Desert, a 35-acre entertainment destination that features 3 live animal attractions - OdySea Aquarium, Butterfly Wonderland, and Dolphinaris.  THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE   Butterfly Wonderland on the Salt River Pima-Maricopa Indian Community reservation, just east of the 101 Freeway at the Via Ventura exit.
