Afterwards, you see the butterfly chrysalis and some moth cocoon displays. Awesome! The best part is once you pass this and walk into a room where they explain the rules about the exhibit. NO TOUCHING BUTTERFLIES!! :'(((( blah! That's ok because they are allowed to touch you! :) Once you spend an ungodly amount of time chasing butterflies and begging them to land on you, back in the building you go to enjoy some desert bugs and aquariums.

This place is definitely overpriced for the size. The exhibit takes about 15 minutes to look at the butterflies.  I took two toddlers and they were quickly bored with this place. I hope their aquarium is better and not overpriced. For the price of this place for 4 I can travel to Tucson and see a much better butterfly exhibit and lunch.

We had a great time, and cannot stress enough how many butterflies there are!  They have a great room where you see the entire life cycle of the butterflies, from chrysalis to hatching to being ready to go into the conservatory to fly around and be admired.  You wait for a guide to let you into a "holding area" of sorts, have to make sure no butterflies escape from the conservatory area.  Unfortunately for my husband when the guide opened the door between the holding area into the conservatory a butterfly flew in low and went under his foot and he unfortunately stepped on it.  It happened in a nano-second and we were mortified.  He lifted his foot up as soon as he realized it, and we really hope it was OK.  When they say watch where you walk they mean it.  We have been to a similar place in Massachusetts many times so we know the drill, this was a fluke thing.  You don't even know where to look there is so much activity and so many beautiful butterflies!  They give you a handout when you come in with photos of the butterflies and you honestly see pretty much all of the ones pictured (like 30 different ones!).  They also have a koi pond, frogs, lizards, scorpions, and fish.    I had to take a star away from their 5-star experience we had because of the pricing in the cafe.  You cannot consume outside food or beverage, and $2.95 plus tax for a 20 oz bottle of Aquafina water is obnoxious.  We already paid almost $50 for two adult admissions, so when our 18 month old was having a breakdown because she was hot and thirsty we had to get her water, and felt it was a bit excessive.    If we lived in the area we would be members, because every week they get chrysalis in and I imagine it is fun to see all different butterflies!

This place was amazing. There's over 2,000 butterflies fluttering around. We had quite a few land on us. Got some great shots of some just breath taking butterflies! The staff was so nice and took time out to talk to you and tell you a little more about the butterflies. They even offered to take some pics for you. The rooms with fish and other animal exhibits were pretty cool. We really liked the bee exhibit. That was pretty cool. It's a fun place to spend an afternoon.

I loved this place so much so I decided to take my niece this weekend for her birthday. Everything was fine until we got into the aquarium area. They have a stingray pool, we walked in and I could hear someone talking with instructions, but it was packed so it was hard to pay attention let alone hear, especially with kiddos running around and trying to get everyone situated and such. We got up to the pool, I stuck my hand in to touch a stingray, probably up to about my elbow and the instructor, who was in the room on a MIC (I had no idea!) SCREAMED at me!! "We don't do that! We don't stick our arms in the pool! Ma'am! You! You in the pink! WE DON'T DO THAT!!" Shaking her finger even and pointing at me.  It was absolutely and utterly embarrassing, especially in a room full of people and she carried on entirely too long about it. Another woman next to my sister was even making comments to her husband about how rude she was and that she clearly needs a new job. I understand if I did something wrong, but the way she handled the situation was SO uncalled for. Would she have yelled at my 4 year old niece like that?? I'm an adult so I can take it, but that would be enough to send any kid running, and probably crying. What a shame!

We loved it so much that we purchased annual passes. I will say though, that a one day pass is a lot of money for what you get. You can only stay in the butterfly atrium for so long. On the inside of the wonderland there are a few reptiles and fish (that's it). Now that the new aquarium is open right next door, maybe they should find something different to do with that room?! The 3D movie is amazing, and never seems to get old.  I do like that they have special events like painting and yoga within the wonderland (at an extra cost). It is super relaxing and mesmerizing to walk through the atrium. I'm glad I purchased the annual pass.

Got to visit Butterfly Wonderland June 30th 2015 with a 9 year old, 11 Year old, 16, 18 and 19 year old. Everyone enjoyed their visit. The 3D movie at the beginning of the tour was just the right length. Informative and visually stimulating. The Stingray display was a big high point for the young ones. Even my 16 year old daughter was all smiles because you are allowed to let the stingray touch your hand. The Butterfly Atrium was beautiful. I sometimes forgot to watch the sidewalk, the butterflies sit on the sidewalk sometimes. So we moved slowly and some of the butterflies landed on people. The Mirror Maze next door was exciting for the kids. Trying to figure out how to get out was fun for all of us. That's ages 9-43. Hahahahahaha

I've been here twice now and my wife and I loved it. The second trip we made out we brought our 10 month old daughter and she enjoyed it from the movie to the nature environment she loved every moment. We will gladly return the next time we're in Arizona.

It's. the place I go to get 'at peace with the world'. All sorts of varieties, every visit is different. Going earlier in the day is better, the butterflies bare more awake and active.  You'll get great photos and video. I recommend a longer pass, you'll want to come back. Some great foods and stores behind it. I have not been to the aquarium ye so I can't speak to it.   They also have some cool talks and classes. (Yes I teach one of those). As it gets humid in the butterfly area you can go in and out of it. They have a small stingray pond as well as other fish and some cool insects.

So many times I've passed by here and was not even remotely interested in going in until my girlfriend took me here on a weekend outing. This was so fun. The outdoor area where the butterflies fly free was amazing. So many beautiful butterflies and they will land on you if you don't mind and walk around with you. A really amazing experience. I'm just sorry I didn't go one of those times I passed by.

My fiancé loves this place! You can buy combo tickets to visit the Odysea Aquarium and this location for a cheaper fee than it would be to purchase admission to both places. Great information on butterflies.
The 3D movie was good. A little expensive for such a small place. Took only about an hour and a half to go through it.

I came here today with my mom at around 11:30 for the first time. The place was easy to find and parking wasn't an issue. It was pretty busy but not too bad to where I wouldn't not want to go in. The prices are a little high though. For two adult tickets it was $41. Which is high just to see butterflies. Right when you walk in you don' really even know where to go. There a gift shop and just a service desk. Go to the service desk where they'll check your tickets. You have to see a about 10 minute long movie which is 3-D before you enter to see the butterflies. Since the movie didn't start right away when we got there they said we could go see the aquarium first to wait. We walked down the hallway and only saw the movie theatre inside. No aquarium. They didn't even ask if we knew where it was or not. There was no signs. Nothing. We walked back to the service desk and asked where the aquarium was. The said it was through two doors that only have a sign that says 'Please open slowly'. You would think the sign would say 'Aquarium' maybe or at least something?? Besides that the aquarium is pretty cool. It's not that big though. There is a eating spot but the prices were too high. The movie is cool though and goes by fast. The butterfly greenhouse is amazing though. It's very very hot and humid inside so I recommend either bringing a water or drinking a lot before going in!

Our first experience was back in August. We came here in honor of our baby girl who passed away and we happened to call her our "Baby Butterfly". We needed a healing experience and this was the perfect place. We drove 5 hours from Las Vegas just to visit this beautiful, enchanting place.  We had such a wonderful time, I wanted to call personally to thank the staff and compliment them. We happened to speak to the executive director and told him our reason for coming and thanked him for a great time. He was so touched that he promised to take extra care of the butterflies in our baby's honor.  I don't even know how to call that great "customer service" because it was so much more than that. We were treated like family.  With an experience like that, we just had to come back. I emailed Mr. Fox to say how excited we were to return.  We arrived yesterday and we greeted by him. He surprised us with bringing us into the conservatory to release a batch of butterflies for their first flight in honor of my baby girl.  Tears rolled down my face...  Butterfly Wonderland knows the true meaning of treating their guests like family.  The entire experience, Was unforgettable, both times and we plan to return soon since we are now lifetime members.
Another placeholder so my pictures link. I'll update with details later, but the 4 star rating holds true.

For the price, this was disappointing. Yes the butterfly area was cool but we spent only an hour in the facility total and there was nothing left for us to do- sad we wasted part of our vacation here instead of just chillin' at the pool.

What a magical place! Butterflies galore! You really feel like you're in a secret garden. The film presentation was educational. The food was good too! The store had a great selection of gifts. The kids and the grand kids had a great time each and every time we have come to visit the butterflies.

Great place to bring the kids or if you're a photographer!  Be prepared however fir 2 things..... no strollers allowed in the butterfly sanctuary although allowed in the aquarium and reptile exhibits and 80% humidity inside the sanctuary.  I liked it but some may not.  Nice cafe' and gift shop also!  Not inexpensive but not crazy either!

Eh- the lay out is horrible! I hate going places and the second I get there is to watch a movie. Then you're shuffled out and into the atrium. The atrium is pretty much the whole part of the experience. After the atrium is the cafe you have to cross into and then the small room of aquatic animals.   I don't like how there is no reason to bring a stroller cuz there is no stroller room in the theater and u can't bring in the atrium- basically no need to bring a stroller.   $7 for a sandwich- the cafe is overpriced.   The only had one stingray to pet.. The other zoos have lots!!   I have to work my way through this maze back to the lobby and cross over the green screen of people taking pictures to use the restroom!

My first time in this palace of knowledge was amazing. Wonderful staff, beautiful exhibits , and future plans that are amazing! I think kids of all ages can get a lot out of this indoor experience. I will definitely be back.

I so wanted to love this place, but I was so disappointed.  *Way too expensive! We spent less than 2 hours and we had seen it all...$19 for adult $10 for kids.  *3D movie was the best part, but it is only 15 minutes. *The Emergence Gallery was so crowded it was difficult to get up to the windows.  *The Garden is pretty and humid. The butterflies are everywhere! But for the price of one day here I can buy my family annual admission to the Botanical Gardens and see the butterflies often and learn more about them and do the annual Monarch tagging.  *The ant farm is a classroom science project...we were very disappointed in the size. *The bee colony was interesting and we did enjoy seeing the bees come and go.  *The fish are in wall tanks and seem like the ones you see everywhere. The sting rays are interesting to watch, but there is no place to wash hands after touching the rays...paper towels on the ledge only. *The only restroom is in the front lobby. You must walk through the gift shop to wash hands or bathroom the children...There is no way to avoid the gift shop to get to the restrooms...difficult with small children.   The concept of an indoor Butterfly Wonderland is great, unfortunately the reality did not seem like a Wonderland. Our family won't be back. This is not a good value for the money.

I'm writing my review mostly based on the customer experience aspect of my visit here with that being said they should really find some new employees everyone here acts and looks like they hate their job. It's defiantly overpriced in my opinion but I do understand that they have to upkeep the atrium at a very humid level so for a one time experience whatever. You can probably view this entire place in about 30 min. They have a neat 3D film on butterflies which was cool but kinda gross that they reuse the glasses I guess they steam clean them But still gross. As far the positive aspects the butterflies were beautiful and everywhere many different species you have to watch where you walk because a lot  Just stay on the floors . A tip for those with babies . Strollers are not aloud in the butterfly area which is a huge inconvenience for some . It's very humid in here so I recommend going when it's cooler I went on a day it was 110 not the best idea lol :) overall it was Fun to bring my daughter and son there for a play date with friends. I am excited to see the aquarium exhibit they are building I will defiantly be going to see that.

We went there on a Wednesday morning and there were a lot of people there -- mostly class trip kids. So we were off to a slow start waiting for the 3D movie and did not have an option to bypass it since there were so many people ahead of us. So, between the 20 minute wait for the movie and the 15 minute movie itself (which I must say was very enjoyable) that was the downside.  The upside started in the butterfly emergence gallery where you could chrysalises in varying stages of development including newly developed butterflies. The only problem here is you are coming into a relatively small room from the larger theater so unless you are the lucky first out of the theater you will be waiting for the viewing wall. (Even though we were part of the lucky I would say the wall is worth the wait)  From there you go into what they describe as America's largest butterfly atrium. Well, I have never experienced anything like it. Large indeed but more amazingly there were butterflies EVERYWHERE. You certainly did not need to look for them and yes, they do land on you as well. Surprisingly the class trips we saw were very well behaved in the atrium. I think it is just the magic of being in a place so different than anything you have ever experienced elsewhere.
Coming from Wisconsin this was an awesome  amazing experience. My daughter absolutely loved being able to interact with the butterflies.

Visited mid week so small crowd and lots of room to walk and and enjoy the atrium. Fun because it's different  - not your normal way to pass the time.  Friendly and knowledgable staff, clean facility, organized exhibits and  centrally located right off the 101. We had no idea we would be able to touch the manta rays, watch ants farm and check out some bees and fish on top of the butterfly experience. It's pretty much a one time visit for me - but I'm glad I knocked it off my list of things to so. My favorite is the "butterfly body check" you need to undergo leaving the atrium. They search for stowaways. Lol

So worth the visit. It's a maybe 30 -60 minute visit. The 3D movie was 12 minutes was a great show on how the butterflies migrate . The actual interaction was relaxing. If you have a toddler maybe not appropriate. The toddlers on the atrium ruined my visit as they ran and screamed during my visit. They should have a toddler time

Take my word and eat somewhere besides the cafe here. The "manager" of the cafe is downright rude and incapable of completing a task as simple as making 2 pretzels with cheese. She completely forgot my order then tried to blame her "employee" (her words) for her incompetence. They are microwaved for goodness sake! She didn't even try to fake an apology. I work in the service industry, this woman seriously needs to find a new line of work. No managerial skills what so ever. I cannot fathom how she got this job or how she has managed to keep it.

*Customer Service 1/2 Stars, As for this it was nothing special but not bad either. Did however see one lady that was working here looking and talking to people negatively when they try and get a butterfly on their finger.   *Experience 1/1 Star, been here multiple times and I have a good time. Went during the week and early in the morning to avoid the crowds so it was even more enjoyable.   *Activity 1/1 Star, you can never go wrong with having hundreds of butterflies doing their thing and fluttering their wings all around you. Also with the occasional ones that land on you hitching a ride around.  *Would I Recommend 1/1 Star, absolutely would recommend  you give this place a try. Lots of fun and especially if you had children.

NOT a place for toddlers and young kids. So, you think 'butterflies'.. that's a 'little kid' thing??   It really isn't for small children and especially for how expensive it is.  It's a crime for this place to charge what they do for parents to bring in small kids who one: will never remember this place and two:  can't behave well enough to be there.  There were three different parents who had to take their '5 and under' children out during the movie.  It's an educational film.  The other small kids who remained were obnoxious- talking WAY out loud as though they were in their living rooms. But kids 2 and under are free.  I have no idea why they are actually encouraging parents to bring kids this young.    It's obnoxiously expensive for what it is.  Yes, the butterfly atrium is cool... but MANY butterflies on the path, and I saw three murdered by small children not watching where they were going, and they just tromped right on 'em.  Not worth the almost TWENTY dollars for an adult.  The aquarium part is nothing beyond something you see in your dentist's office.  All of the Mini stingrays were lying on the bottom of their tank and the guy said, "Oh, they're nocturnal".  Really?  They aren't at the zoo... and if they actually are then why put them in an exhibit open during the DAY?   Be prepared for the almost 'Hitchcock' feel of the butterfly atrium.  If this type of thing creeps you out, steer clear.  This is NOT like the Botanical garden butterfly exhibit where butterflies are sitting mostly on plants.   These are flying all over the place.  Cool to some- creepy to others.    So, long story short- take an international student whose never seen a butterfly OR a special older person who can appreciate the process, can read the exhibits and can enjoy the beauty that this small place offers.    I can't believe I just spent almost 80.00 for a family of four for about 90 minutes of somewhat interesting activity.    I can't imagine this place lasting at these prices. Although, it was very crowded- so, who am I to say.
Amazing experience. Truly a treat for us on our trip from CA to AZ. the staff was so kind, the butterflies were gorgeous and the baby quails were adorable. Thank you for a great morning adventure!!

Kind of a random structure out in the middle of the desert.   When it was being built, we all were wondering what was being erected off of the 101 in such a peculiar spot.  Still looks a bit odd standing out there surrounded by...nothing.  I suppose in 10 years, we might look back and say, "remember when the Butterfly Wonderland was the only thing on that plot of land?"  Anyhow, despite the high prices, this is a nice little spot to visit once (probably any more than one visit, and you'll quickly bore).  We watched the introductory 3D butterfly movie twice -- it actually really is that good, and that entertaining...and quite informative.  The next exhibit room features butterflies that are just starting to crack out of their cocoons.  The larger species are fascinating!  The actual butterfly room is more fun than you would think, chiefly because most folks like us play a little game of, "how still can I stand so that a butterfly lands on me."  I had 4 at one time...not too shabby.  This is a good spot to take the family on one of those hot summer days when you have nothing else to do, or when you have family in town.

This a great place for all ages. We really enjoyed the fantastic 3D video intro about the Monarch butterfly. There are many beautiful butterflies to see up close in a natural environment. Also there is a bee hive which bees are able to go outside, collect pollen, and return. The queen is visible. There is a wonderful aquarium with fish swimming around and touchable! The best!!!! Thanks for co I g to Scottsdale. Anyone want to volunteer there with me?

LOCATION/PARKING:  Right off the 101. Easy, free parking.  THINGS TO DO: There is a big butterfly house, a stingray petting tank, some fish tanks, a few insect exhibits, an informative and beautiful 15 minute 3D movie, an impressive gift shop, and a small no frills cafe.  The butterfly house is great! Very large, well maintained, relaxing, and even plays gentle music in the background. The butterflies are beautiful and there are never-ending opportunities for taking some beautiful photos!   The 3D movie is fun- be prepared for kids squealing.  It is beautifully done and provides a good bit of information about monarchs and their migration to/from Mexico.   The other exhibits are pretty weak, but well maintained and you can see the potential.   VALUE: Sort of on the pricey side (about $18 admission, includes everything; cheaper for kids/seniors) but is enjoyable.   NOTEWORTHY:  Be careful not to step on a butterfly!!  FINAL VERDICT: I would recommend a stop here. Perfect place for a family outing, a date, a solo trip to see something different, a casual day trip for friends.  If you are okay with the idea of spending money to walk among butterflies, I can safely say that you would enjoy it here.

This place was awesome!! It's small but worth the trip. Very relaxing and beautiful, how cool to be surrounded with 2500k butterflies at one time! It was like being in a cartoon. Kid friendly but fun for adults too.

I went to Butterfly Wonderland on Saturday...What a LOVELY experience! Hundreds and hundreds of butterflies large and small and every color of the rainbow and more are flying freely around the enclosure and landing on any and everyone there...what a mesmerizing sight...everyone had smiles on their faces, all ages of folks dressed in all sorts of garb...so relaxing...I'd definitely go back, my Mom was over the moon...it was incredible...I would suggest that before going in you take a good look at your children and decide if they're ready to venture into such a place because there is NO TOUCHING of the butterflies, let alone SCREAMING AND RUNNING AND SWATTING AT THEM...I was shocked by parents who just drug their children in without any concern about what their reaction would be! I was mortified as were all the adults around me (except their parents)...other than that, it was a WONDERFUL DAY and I'd recommend this experience to EVERYONE that would like to enjoy a steamy afternoon enjoying the beauty of nature...KUDOS DEE...We'll be back! Go Buckeyes:)

Great place to take your kids, grandkids & nieces or nephews. The butterflies and quite entertaining and beautiful. Really enjoyed taking photos of the butterflies landing on us and enjoyed watching them interact with other butterflies.

Such a wonderful experience for the whole family! I will say it's a little pricey for just an hour or two, but getting to be right in the midst of so many gorgeous butterflies made it worth it.   Side note is that some of the younger kiddos, like toddler age are scared for the butterflies to land on them.

Nice opportunity to see butterflies up close but not personally worth the price at $20 per adult. Stingray touch tank and fish tanks are also a slight step above visiting a pet store. Better off spending your money at the Phoenix Zoo. I'd rate this as 4-5 star if the attraction were priced more fairly at $12-15 per adult given that you'll probably only spend two hours at this venue. It's basically a commercial tourist trap to make money off of nature. I'm expecting the OdySea Aquarium to be much if the same. Save your money and visit a real nature preserve.  Also, they don't let you feed butterflies as we've seen at other butterfly exhibits and have tight rules (compared to most other aquariums and the Phoenix Zoo) when touching the stingrays. You basically put up to two knuckles in the water and let them swim up to you whereas at the Phoenix Zoo, you can actually feed them shrimp and pet their backs which is more of a true touch tank experience. The only upside to the "touch tank" is that the water is still enough to take photos of the stingrays (when they're swimming) because there's so little action (kids reaching in the water, too many rules about touching the stingrays) that you can actually get photos of them swimming by.

I've been here twice and it is very nice. In reading through some of the reviews on Yelp it's pretty clear that some folks thought this would be a Disney theme park for their children to play in.  It is not. If you are looking for a fun day with your kids, take them to the zoo where they can run around and express some of their energy.   Butterflies are fragile creatures and they live only a week or two so naturally the staff can't let little Susie and Billy chase them around and grab them by the wings. To be honest, most kids are bored stiff after 10 or 15 minutes. This place is really geared to adults in my opinion.   Upon entering, you may choose to see a 3D movie about the migration of the Monarch butterfly. The movie lasts 15 minutes and it's worth the time. You can then proceed into an area where there are many cocoons and chrysalises. You may be as lucky as we were and you'll get to see a butterfly come out of their chrysalis. It was pretty epic!  You then go into the atrium and walk among the butterflies, listen to beautiful music and simply enjoy the beauty of nature.   I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 because I found the small stingray pond and introductory aquarium to be too small to enjoy so it felt like an after thought. Not a deal breaker for me, but it's something I'd just walk on by next time I go.   In my view, $20 is fair for the experience they are providing. It costs some bucks to support a place where the displayed creatures die every other week.

This place is so cool and a fun place to take the kids especially when it is so hot outside here in the valley. We spent the day with our kids here and learned more about butterflies. They took a picture of all of us when we walked in. It was sort of pricey for all of us to go and I was expecting the picture they took to be given to us at the end. However I understand they are running a business I was just under the impression they would by how they approached us in the beginning.  They have a little area to eat and they have a 3D movie before you go in to the area to see the butterflies. Our oldest daughter was a little afraid of the butterflies which I didn't see coming and it was humid in the butterfly area, again because it needs to be for the butterflies and little birds they have there. I loved having the butterflies land on me and taking pictures there. All the employees were really nice and the gift shop at the end had a lot of cool stuff to buy however once again slightly expensive. It was expected based on my experience with going to the zoo in the past. I would love to go back sometime for sure.

We went here on Christmas Day and it was wonderful. The staff is helpful and cheery and the butterflies were so beautiful to see up close.  My daughter is 7 and she did get slightly irked at the butterflies flying so close to her and even landing on her so I think a little prep for your kids is in order if they are  squeamish about bugs.  I loved this place and will definitely be visiting soon.

I visited Butterfly Wonderland twice. It's right next to the aquarium. It's very educational, and I enjoyed the 3D film! The butterflies are beautiful (they have so many flying around, the blues are my favorites) but I do wish they'd put up signs to remind people to watch where they step. The butterflies land on the ground, and people forget to watch for them. The gift shop is very nice!

Came here with my family and didn't know what to expect. The 3D movie was entertaining and quite informative. What was really cool was seeing the chrysalis of the butterflies and moths arranged by species. The main butterfly atrium was really special. It was awesome to see and be in an area with butterflies flying and gliding all around. Some even landed and rested on our shoulders and arms!  Highly recommend checking out Butterfly Wonderland. Very unique and we enjoyed all the new knowledge we gleaned from this experience.

The actual exhibit is amazing.  The conservatory obviously, is the best part. It was difficult for anyone in or group actually wanting to leave! We just wanted to sit there and enjoy the experience! It was definitely crowded. However I could tolerate that. What honestly ruins the experience is having to see parents that obviously are too obsessed with taking selfies, and letting their children run around and stomp on the butterflies.  The workers in the conservatory also did not actually seem to care about the butterflies much at all. (At least that I saw).  Again, another wonderful experience, if you can tolerate the people or go at a time when it's not very crowded.

What do you get when you cross a bunch of butterflies with a dream? Why yes, you're absolutely correct: Butterfly Wonderland. I can describe my visit to the largest Butterfly atrium in America but it definitely won't do enough justice. Butterfly Wonderland isn't hard to find at all. It's right off the 101 and you'll see it coming off the exit. Parking is ample and there are ticket windows up front for entrance.   When you enter, there are a couple of employees to greet you-one to check your ticket stubs and one to take your picture with the beautiful butterfly backdrop. You are then escorted to the theater to watch a 3-D documentary on the life cycle of a butterfly (don't worry; it won't put you to sleep). After the film, you are pretty much free to explore the atrium. Directly outside of the theater were displays of caterpillars in their cocoons. I wasn't planning on staying long but I actually lost track of time in the atrium. They did a great job with the whole "wonderland illusion" of the atrium. Besides the butterflies, beautiful plants, trees, waterfalls and ponds fill the atrium. All the while, they have fairytale-like music playing overhead really softly which pretty much does the trick on the "wonderland" ambiance.   There are soooo many different types of butterflies and I could literally spend hours there. Visitors should be careful while walking around the atrium-butterflies land everywhere so there were a bunch of them on the ground. I was lucky enough to have a pretty little white butterfly land on my shoulder. The song "Butterfly on Her Shoulder" immediately started playing in my head (Hawaii locals, you know this one)!  Butterfly Wonderland also has a cute café and a gift shop. The café had a pretty simple menu and items were overpriced. The gift shop on the other hand, was far from simple and had a ton of souvenirs to offer but yes, overpriced as well.   Bottom line: just go! Butterfly Wonderland isn't just for pretty little princesses either, it's for the entire family and adults alone. In fact, if you're having a rough day or are under stress, I highly recommend going. There's just something about the atmosphere that is really calming. Not to mention, it really puts into perspective that things do change and things do get better over time. "If nothing ever changed, there'd be no butterflies."

An exciting place to see beautiful different species of butterflies. The 15 minute 3D video about Monarch butterflies was informative and enjoyable. You then enter into a room with a few cases of emerging butterflies and it was actually very cool to see all the different types of chrysalis. The atrium is full of a butterflies that fly all around you. For the butterflies comfort, the room is extremely humid and hot so don't expect to spend too much time in there before melting. You then see a small display of ants and bees and then fish and sting rays. There is also a little cafe, but I did not eat there. Overall, I think the place is something to check out once, but nothing to rush to. However, I thought it was way over priced. I paid the $16.95 student fee, which came to $18 with tax, $10 would have been more reasonable. You only spend an hour there before you're ready to leave (and really you could see it all in 30 minutes if you really wanted to). The staff member in the fish room couldn't tell us anything and was googling things for us, which we could have done ourselves. He said he normally works in the butterfly area, so maybe we just went at the wrong time. I thought there would be more information about the different species and more displays of butterflies in frames.

This Woo Hoo is specifically for the excellent customer service we received. It is spring break and we grandmas decided to take a trip to Butterfly Wonderland. We had all kinds of stuff going on from, children/student, senior discounts, AAA, to $ off coupons. Martha, the Retail Manager was so helpful, kind, patient and understanding she helped us get the best price for the combination Butterfly/Mirror/Laser exhibits. This woohoo is for Martha from a grateful grandma. The Woohoo is also for an overall great time. The Butterflies are serene and the mirror, laser exhibit is very cool and all age appropriate (parents should accompany toddlers the mirrors are amazing!)
Everyone must go.  Young and old.  Friendly, qualified staff makes the difference.  Gorgeous facility.  It takes about 2 hours to enjoy.

There's not a whole lot of indoor activities to do in Phoenix besides shopping and museums, so when this Butterfly Wonderland opened up, I was really excited!  Plus I'm a huge animal freak.  So we went, and butterfly enclosure was nice and big and had lots of butterflies and the video was interesting.  BUT Here's why I only gave it 3 stars:  - Located in the middle of nowhere.  Be prepared for a 45-min. drive if coming from Peoria or Glendale - Confusing admission lines.  Due to the 100+ degree weather, they re-directed the line from the outdoor ticket stands to the indoor gift shop check-out counter.  What resulted was a confused mass of people standing around in the gift shop not realizing that some lines were credit card only.  Why they put the ticket counters outside in the first place is a mystery. - Butterfly enclosure was torturously humid.  Combine that with the fact that you're basically in a greenhouse, and you've got one sweaty, uncomfortable lady here.  It was too hard to enjoy the plants, flowers, and butterflies with buckets of sweat pouring off my face.  We had to leave the greenhouse so I could recover before going back out to see more butterflies. - Expensive admission for the amount of stuff you get to see.  Besides the butterfly greenhouse, there's really only a 3D butterfly movie, a cocoon nursery, and an ant farm to look at.

Though I love so much of what Butterfly Wonderland has to offer, they simply MUST do something about the pervasive smell of sewage that greets you the moment you walk in the door and in other parts of the building (also outside near the parking lot). I won't be going back until I hear they've solved this awful smell and whatever is causing it.

I hate to give this place less than a 3 star review.  I am giving it this because the cost-to-experience ratio is skewed.  This place, in my opinion is not worth $19 Adult and $9 for kids.  You can also spend more and see a light show and some other things.  My opinion would be to visit the butterfly exhibit at the Desert Botanical Garden.  You spend about 4 or 5 dollars more, but you can have the same butterfly experience AND tour the beautiful garden.    I could not make the connect in this place between the amazon fish and the butterflies.  I guess the fact that the conservatory is like a rain forest... so the Amazon is in a rain forest, so include fish in this exhibit.  Ok.  I got it.  not really.  I could understand the stretch to include the bees, but I could not understand why they included ants, scorpions and spiders.  There may have been posted signs to explain, but I don't recall seeing why these creatures were at Butterfly Wonderland.  It seems to me as though, at the last minute they decided to throw in some sharks and fish and some bugs to help extend the exhibit.  Furthermore, their guides/employees are not as helpful or informative as the DBG Butterfly exhibit.   I would have expected guides to be walking around and basically talking to people to share the information, like in other butterfly conservatories I've visited.    The 3 bright spots were the 3D film and the butterfly conservatory ...  because of the butterflies AND the wonderful climate-controlled humidity of the rain-forest like atmosphere.  Oh how I loved that humidity.  I didn't want to leave.  Don't be silly and wear jeans or you'll be very hot.  The 3rd bright spot was certainly the Butterfly emergence... watch butterflies emerge from their chrysalises (some of them look like piece of jewelry!) and spread their wings for the first time.  AMAZING show right there.  Perhaps this place is worth a one-time visit.  For me I wish I had saved my money.

Hahahaha, I love reading the reviews that complain about the high humidity.  I went in August, and yes, it was muggy and uncomfortable, but I still enjoyed the experience.  I'm sure the butterflies would not appreciate having the A/C on... The place is a bit pricey, but again, a very enjoyable experience for my kids, husband and I.  My kids loved all of it, including the 3D movie.  My husband and I loved the chrysalis exhibit, i had never seen anything like it, they look like jewels!   And the actual greenhouse is not that big, true.  I expected a much, much larger place.  But nobody is kicking you out...stay and enjoy the experience.  Sit down, take pictures, ask the volunteers for information, or google it and tell your kids about it.  Reading other reviews for this place, I'd say I'm easily pleased.  I've seen better, since I've been to Costa Rica and went to a huge butterfly place.  Huge.  So this one can't compare on size...but guess what?  The Costa Rica place was hotter and muggier than this one :)
